columns.name: filter
columns.description: The cloudwatch filter pattern for the search.

columns.name: log_group_name
columns.description: The name of the log group to which this event belongs.

columns.name: log_stream_name
columns.description: The name of the log stream to which this event belongs.

columns.name: timestamp
columns.description: The time when the event occurred.

columns.name: timestamp_ms
columns.description: The time when the event occurred.

columns.name: access_key_id
columns.description: The AWS access key ID that was used to sign the request. If the request was made with temporary security credentials, this is the access key ID of the temporary credentials.

columns.name: aws_region
columns.description: The AWS region that the request was made to, such as us-east-2.

columns.name: error_code
columns.description: The AWS service error if the request returns an error.

columns.name: error_message
columns.description: If the request returns an error, the description of the error.

columns.name: event_category
columns.description: Shows the event category that is used in LookupEvents calls.

columns.name: event_id
columns.description: The ID of the event.

columns.name: event_name
columns.description: The name of the event returned.

columns.name: event_source
columns.description: The AWS service that the request was made to.

columns.name: event_time
columns.description: The date and time the request was made, in coordinated universal time (UTC).

columns.name: event_type
columns.description: Identifies the type of event that generated the event record.

columns.name: event_version
columns.description: The version of the log event format.

columns.name: read_only
columns.description: Information about whether the event is a write event or a read event.

columns.name: recipient_account_id
columns.description: Represents the account ID that received this event.

columns.name: request_id
columns.description: The value that identifies the request.

columns.name: shared_event_id
columns.description: GUID generated by CloudTrail to uniquely identify CloudTrail events from the same AWS action that is sent to different AWS accounts.

columns.name: source_ip_address
columns.description: The IP address that the request was made from.

columns.name: user_agent
columns.description: The agent through which the request was made, such as the AWS Management Console, an AWS service, the AWS SDKs or the AWS CLI.

columns.name: user_type
columns.description: The name of the event returned.

columns.name: username
columns.description: The user name of the user that made the api request.

columns.name: user_identifier
columns.description: The name/arn of user/role that made the api call.

columns.name: vpc_endpoint_id
columns.description: Identifies the VPC endpoint in which requests were made from a VPC to another AWS service, such as Amazon S3.

columns.name: additional_event_data
columns.description: Additional data about the event that was not part of the request or response.

columns.name: cloudtrail_event
columns.description: The CloudTrail event in the json format.

columns.name: request_parameters
columns.description: The parameters, if any, that were sent with the request.

columns.name: response_elements
columns.description: The response element for actions that make changes (create, update, or delete actions).

columns.name: resources
columns.description: A list of resources referenced by the event returned.

columns.name: tls_details
columns.description: Shows information about the Transport Layer Security (TLS) version, cipher suites, and the FQDN of the client-provided host name of a service API call.

columns.name: user_identity
columns.description: Information about the user that made the request.
